alert.note: Alert for Chuska Mountains; Tusas Mountains Including Chama (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued February 28 at 7:24PM MST until March 02 at 5:00PM MST by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 5 AM WEDNESDAY TO 5 PM MST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow. Total snow accumulations between 6 and 12 inches possible with higher amounts up to 18 inches above 9000 feet in the Tusas Mountains. Winds could gust as high as 45 mph producing blowing snow and low visibility. * WHERE...Tusas Mountains Including Chama and Chuska Mountains. * WHEN...From 5 AM Wednesday to 5 PM MST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Some roads may be closed. Significant travel delays are possible. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. For the latest road conditions, dial 511 or 1.800.432.4269, or visit http://nmroads.com.

area.areaDesc: Chuska Mountains; Tusas Mountains Including Chama
